page.title: 11DAILY LIFE
page.content: {A Day in the Life of a Farmer's Wife I get up at 7.15 a.m., wash, dress, make the beds, come downstairs, switch on the washing machine, eat my breakfast, then see my sons off to the nearby Primary School at 8.30 a.m. I hang out the washing weather permitting then generally tidy up the house. After preparing the lunch, I leave at 10 a.m. for Scooniehill, a neighbouring farm, to help a group of mentally/physically handicapped children, from Kilmaron School, Cupar,learn to groom and ride horses under the Riding for the Disabled Association. Lunch is at noon for my husband and myself, the boys join us at 12.30 p.m. I like to spend afternoons working in my garden.
